biogHist.p: Chemist, Administrator, 1932-. Upon completing his education at Iowa State University, Dr. B. Kratochvil joined the Department of Chemistry at the University of Alberta in 1967 and was appointed Chair in 1989. A researcher in chemical analysis, he co-wrote three texts on analytical chemistry with Walter E. Harris and numerous articles on chemical analysis and other topics related to chemistry. He was named Chair of the University of Alberta SLOWPOKE Reactor Facility Committee in 1989. In 1990 Dr. Kratochvil won the Fisher Award for Analytical Chemistry. Complementing his work as a chemist, he also worked in the administrative sector of the University of Alberta, and retired in 1998 as Associate Vice-President. Upon retirement, Dr. Kratochvil continued his research and is currently (2002) studying the problems associated with sampling and analysis of the Athabasca oil sands.
